metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16878 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in pacemaker up to and including version 2.0.1. An insufficient verification inflicted preference of uncontrolled processes can lead to DoS

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcib4 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libcrmcluster4 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libcrmcommon3 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libcrmservice3 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
liblrmd1 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libpe-rules2 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libpe-status10 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libpengine10 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libstonithd2 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
libtransitioner2 - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
pacemaker - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
pacemaker-cli-utils - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
pacemaker-common - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
pacemaker-remote - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
pacemaker-resource-agents - 1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: pacemaker package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.18-0ubuntu1.1').
